results.content:
This is a very good resource for beginners who want to get started with Struts 2. I liked the way the course was designed, with the basic structure laid out, and each aspect covered part by part, and with clarity. It is a good place to start from and build upon.

I especially liked the idea of using colors to denote different layers in the Struts architecture, and personifying them. Really helps with the mental image, and following that with the actual name/purpose of the layer. 

Would appreciate some detailed content around customization of different components involved in Struts2 architecture.

Thanks!!
results.content_html:
This is a very good resource for beginners who want to get started with Struts 2. I liked the way the course was designed, with the basic structure laid out, and each aspect covered part by part, and with clarity. It is a good place to start from and build upon.

I especially liked the idea of using colors to denote different layers in the Struts architecture, and personifying them. Really helps with the mental image, and following that with the actual name/purpose of the layer.

Would appreciate some detailed content around customization of different components involved in Struts2 architecture.

Thanks!!

results.content:
It's wonderful! Before I learnt this course, I already had some experiences with struts2 and Spring. I bought this course because I want to review this framework before starting my graduation project.

The instructor explained MVC pattern very well, as good as he taught how struts2 works.

Suggestions：I recommend the instructor can add some in-depth knowledge regarding how struts2 works. For example, from the struts2.xml, the JVM uses Java reflection to create action object. The instructor could have gone deeper in explaining what "reflection" is and how it works. 

And more importantly, the instructor could have taught students a way to generate the struts2.xml file and other files automatically in ME. The instructor did a good thing in copying all the !doctype tag to the word document. However, if not with these notes, how would a student create his/her own struts2.xml and other config files?

But generally, the course is excellent and I highly recommend those who wish to learn struts2 to buy!
results.content_html:
It's wonderful! Before I learnt this course, I already had some experiences with struts2 and Spring. I bought this course because I want to review this framework before starting my graduation project.

The instructor explained MVC pattern very well, as good as he taught how struts2 works.

Suggestions：I recommend the instructor can add some in-depth knowledge regarding how struts2 works. For example, from the struts2.xml, the JVM uses Java reflection to create action object. The instructor could have gone deeper in explaining what "reflection" is and how it works.

And more importantly, the instructor could have taught students a way to generate the struts2.xml file and other files automatically in ME. The instructor did a good thing in copying all the !doctype tag to the word document. However, if not with these notes, how would a student create his/her own struts2.xml and other config files?

But generally, the course is excellent and I highly recommend those who wish to learn struts2 to buy!

results.content: Very high level at this point.  It should be noted that just because a framework is used doesn't mean the code is maintainable.  If people don't follow the documentation of the framework (i.e. place their business logic in a service layer but instead place all their logic in the controller) you have a pile of crappy code that happens to use a framework.
results.content_html: Very high level at this point. It should be noted that just because a framework is used doesn't mean the code is maintainable. If people don't follow the documentation of the framework (i.e. place their business logic in a service layer but instead place all their logic in the controller) you have a pile of crappy code that happens to use a framework.

main reason I am taking down a star is there are 99 videos and in each you start with intro and outro..it shouldn't happen in Udemy course...max do it for each chapter and not for each subtopic...
 
p.s. do add subtitles , as almost every course does have one and might help other people who are having difficulty in understanding ..
Thanks..

results.content:
I mostly worked on batch programming and recently started working on front end, web development. I was looking for Struts Video Tutorials which are very less available in youtube and the ones which are available are not consistent.

This course gave me good start and good understanding of Struts flow and MVC framework. This is what I was looking for. Topics are systematically structured and well explained. 

There are enough programs for hands on, by doing that on your own you will learn many things. I do recommend this course for the people who are beginners and thinking of making hands dirty on front end side of web development.
results.content_html:

results.content:
Avrei preferito più slide di supporto al corso, utili più che altro per ripassare velocemente i contenuti senza dover visionare nuovamente tutti i video.
Avrei preferito inoltre una metodologia più "step-by-step", in cui si crea nuovamente il progetto su cui lavorare in ogni video. In questo modo non sarei costretto a tornare indietro ai video precedenti per ricordare ogni passo (almeno le prime volte).
results.content_html:

results.content: Good introduction to Struts2 and many other topics. owards the later part it touches upon some advanced topics i will say. But would have loved to see a little but more in details. Beginner level things only, but in more details e.g. to how to insert multiple values via PreparedStatement ... in lecture the instructor just edits and changes the hard coded values. I am sure that's not how things are done in real world. Small things like this should have been discussed, which are not advanced level concepts but would have made the understanding more concrete and practical oriented.
results.content_html: Good introduction to Struts2 and many other topics. owards the later part it touches upon some advanced topics i will say. Beginner level things only, but in more details e.g. to how to insert multiple values via PreparedStatement ... in lecture the instructor just edits and changes the hard coded values. I am sure that's not how things are done in real world. Small things like this should have been discussed, which are not advanced level concepts but would have made the understanding more concrete and practical oriented.

results.content:
The course content was over-all great but there were too many minor issues (not incorrect but inefficient) in the Java code.

It would also be improved if a section based on Struts2 Annotations could be added. For example converting the ProductManagementApp from using struts.xml to only using Annotations (if possible).
results.content_html:
The course content was over-all great but there were too many minor issues (not incorrect but inefficient) in the Java code.

It would also be improved if a section based on Struts2 Annotations could be added. For example converting the ProductManagementApp from using struts.xml to only using Annotations (if possible).

results.content: It is a pretty decent course. The support from the instructor leaves a lot to be desired. The instructor takes a long time to answer questions.

results.content:
As the title of the course Struts2 Framework for Beginners, It's  suitable for beginner to quick start with the struts2 framework after completing this course. But my expectation not match with the course , but still I learn 2 to 3 topics which I have not learnt yet. Some of the basic best practices are not followed in this course to make code reusable.
At last I would thanks the instructors for making the course, at least I have learnt some of the concept from the course. I suggest only the beginners to enroll in this course not for advance and intermediate.
results.content_html:
As the title of the course Struts2 Framework for Beginners, It's suitable for beginner to quick start with the struts2 framework after completing this course. But my expectation not match with the course , but still I learn 2 to 3 topics which I have not learnt yet. Some of the basic best practices are not followed in this course to make code reusable.
At last I would thanks the instructors for making the course, at least I have learnt some of the concept from the course. I suggest only the beginners to enroll in this course not for advance and intermediate.

results.content: This course is the best resource to get introduced to Struts2 but it would be more helpful if you add some more topics like file uploading, exception handling,  mail operations,  request through a REST controller and also deployment of structs application in tomcat dynamically instead of entering a URL in the browser  every time for accessing a specific page.
results.content_html: This course is the best resource to get introduced to Struts2 but it would be more helpful if you add some more topics like file uploading, exception handling, mail operations, request through a REST controller and also deployment of structs application in tomcat dynamically instead of entering a URL in the browser every time for accessing a specific page.

results.content:
The course is pretty good, but there are short cuts that the instructor takes that has led to quite a bit of debugging for me.

I think the course needs to be split into two courses. The part with JDBC seemed like a second course. 

I had a hard time getting tomcat loaded onto my machine and getting Eclipse configured to use it. 

I didn't bother loading oracle because I did not want to create a user account with oracle nor did I want to spend hours getting it run like I did with tomcat.

I noticed that both the tomcat and oracle versions are old (it is nearly 2019 now)

results.content:
I concetti sono spiegati in maniera molto semplice e diretta. Possono essere compresi da un utente di qualsiasi livello.
Si potrebbe anche alzare un po' il livello di "difficoltà" in maniera tale da rendere più interessante il corso.
Per un utente avanzato è più utile leggere la documentazione ufficiale.

Well I only learned the basic architecture of the framework.
All the tags and everything else is easier to learn from documentation directly. It should have go directly to functional details, not enumerate some options, just make a quick relation between them and/or maybe show more examples about that.
